name: Simple Present
description: Describes habitual actions, general truths, or facts
examples: I walk to school every day.
She studies English on weekends.

name: Present Continuous
description: Describes actions happening now or around now
examples: I am walking to school now.
They are watching a movie.

name: Present Perfect
description: Describes actions that started in the past and continue to the present, or have recently finished
examples: I have finished my homework.
She has visited London twice.

name: Present Perfect Continuous
description: Describes actions that started in the past, are still ongoing, and have a connection to the present
examples: I have been studying for three hours.
He has been working here since 2010.

name: Simple Past
description: Describes completed actions in the past
examples: I walked to the store yesterday.
They watched a movie last night.

name: Past Continuous
description: Describes actions in progress at a specific time in the past
examples: I was reading a book when you called.
They were playing football at 5 PM.

name: Past Perfect
description: Describes an action completed before another action in the past
examples: I had finished my meal before he arrived.
She had left when I called her.

name: Past Perfect Continuous
description: Describes actions that were ongoing before another past action
examples: I had been working all day before I took a break.
They had been studying for hours before the test.

name: Simple Future
description: Describes actions that will happen in the future
examples: I will go to the gym tomorrow.
She will call you later.

name: Future Continuous
description: Describes actions that will be in progress at a specific time in the future
examples: I will be working at 8 PM.
They will be traveling next week.

name: Future Perfect
description: Describes actions that will be completed before a specific time in the future
examples: I will have finished the project by Friday.
She will have left by the time you arrive.

name: Future Perfect Continuous
description: Describes actions that will be ongoing up to a specific time in the future
examples: I will have been working here for five years next month.
They will have been studying for three hours by noon.
